Authors:
Vasyl P. Heluta, siska arie santy siahaan, Susumu
Takamatsu
Title:
Erysiphe symphoricarpi (Erysiphales), the first record in
Ukraine
Keywords:
powdery mildew fungi, molecular phylogeny, introduced
North American fungus, ornamental planting, Symphoricarpos,
snowberry.
Abstract:
It is reported that powdery mildew on an ornamental plant
Symphoricarpos albus (Oleaceae) was registered in Ukraine. The fungus
that caused the disease formed mainly the mycelium and conidial
sporification, but several fruit bodies were also found. Only one of the
chasmothecia was mature. Its morphological characteristics suggest that
the fungus belongs to the common North American species Erysiphe
(Microsphaera) symphoricarpi. Two separate phylogenetic analyses using
ITS and 28S rDNA sequences were done in this study. The fungus on S.
albus collected in Ukraine grouped with E. symphoricarpi collected in
Hungary, UK, and USA with strong bootstrap supports (MP = 100 %, ML =
100 %). This is the first record of this species in Ukraine. In 2015, E.
symphoricarpi was collected only in Kiev. It is assumed that the fungus
can cause significant damage to ornamental plantings of Ukraine.
